perturbation.original_text: Contribution by Sponsor: In consideration for the right to sponsor the Kaya Fest and to be acknowledged by Fruit of Life Productions LLC., as a Promoter of the event during the term of this Agreement, Sponsor agrees to contract with Fruit of Life Productions LLC., for the amount of $250,000.00 to be paid in full upon signing of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Contribution by Sponsor: In consideration for the right to sponsor the Kaya Fest and to be acknowledged by Fruit of Life Productions LLC., as a Promoter of the event during the term of this Agreement, Sponsor agrees to contract with Fruit of Life Productions LLC., for the amount of $250,000.00 to be paid in full within 30 days of signing this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires payment 'upon signing,' but the modified text allows payment 'within 30 days of signing.' This introduces ambiguity regarding the exact payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: The term of this agreement will begin on April 1, 2018 and continue until April 30, 2018 at 11:59pm.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this agreement will begin on April 1, 2018 and continue indefinitely unless terminated with a 30-day written notice by either party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states a fixed term. The modified text introduces an indefinite term with a termination clause, contradicting the initial fixed duration.

perturbation.original_text: Assignment: This Agreement, or the rights granted under it, may not be assigned transferred or sublicense by either party without the express prior written consent of the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: Assignment: This Agreement and its rights can be freely assigned, transferred, or sublicensed by either party to any affiliate without prior written consent. However, for non-affiliates, the express prior written consent of the other party is required.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause prohibits assignment without consent. The modified clause allows assignment to affiliates without consent, creating a contradiction regarding assignment rights.
